abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Access
            to Financial Services Project for Ukraine is to increase
            access by farmers and rural entrepreneurs and enterprises to
            financial services. The environmental assessment (EA)
            evaluated impacts as follows : air emissions and noise
            pollution; forest degradation; loss of aquatic species; loss
            of biodiversity; community disruption; water pollution and
            soil erosion; salinization, water logging and
            desertification; house renting and services for enterprises;
            use of fertilizers and pesticides; use of hormones and
            chemicals in meat and animal products. As a result of this
            assessment the EA addresses the following mitigation
            measures: advice farmers on the proper handling and
            application of pesticides and fertilizers; recommend
            effective cultivation techniques (including the size of
            tractors and type of equipment) that will reduce the threat
            of soil erosion; select irrigation schemes that will reduce
            the loss of productive land through salinization and water
            logging; install manure handling facilities designated to
            ensure zero runoff; safeguard storage of fuels, lubricants
            and chemicals; proper disposal of hotels and restaurants
            wastes preventing water contamination, disease and vermin;
            purchase tractors with high efficiency emissions control;
            zero use of hormones and minimal use of drugs; and finally,
            organize workshops on environmental impact assessment with
            emphasis on identification of potential environmental
            problems and their consequences.
